titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Nelson Sullivan Video Collection
1976 - 1989
MSS.357
titlestmt.author: Cristina Vignone, 2013. Photographic material processed by Emily B. King, 2013.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-03-11 07:57:53 -0500.

change.item: Updated by Kelly Haydon and Michael Grant to reflect the digitization and description of Super8mm films.
Edited by Rachel Mahre to reflect the digitization of Video8 tapes.

did.abstract: Nelson Sullivan (1948-1989) was a video artist who documented downtown New York City in the 1980s. The Nelson Sullivan Video Collection contains videorecordings, film, photographic material, and objects relating to the city's art world and LGBT community as well as performances in clubs, house parties, and interactions with Sullivan's friends from 1976-1989.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The archivist preserved the original order of the video collection as donated by the estate of Nelson Sullivan. The series of videorecordings have not been chronologically or thematically rearranged.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nelson Sullivan (1948-1989) was a video artist who documented downtown New York City in the 1980s. Originally from South Carolina, Sullivan moved to Manhattan in the 1970s and began filming the city's art world and gay scene. He captured John Sex, Sylvia Miles, RuPaul, and other performers at downtown bars and nightclubs including Danceteria, the Limelight, Palladium, and the Pyramid Club. Sullivan also chronicled house parties at his apartment at 5 Ninth Avenue in the Meatpacking District, gallery openings, park and street festivals, conversations with taxi drivers, and the ruminations of his friends including fashion designer Alexis Del Lago and journalist Michael Musto on film. He recorded almost 2,000 hours of tape, at first using a VHS-loading camera and later an 8mm video camera. Sullivan's filmmaking is recognizable for its point of view transitions and its stream-of-consciousness narration. He also often pointed a wide-angle lens at his own face while filming to record his commentary on the people, performances, or events that he captured. Sullivan made films up until his death from a heart attack on July 4, 1989.
A Very Short Introduction to Nelson Sullivan (http://merepseudbloged.wordpress.com/2010/02/20/a-very-short-introduction-to-nelson-sullivan/)
John Sanchez Interview with Dick Richards about Nelson Sullivan (http://www.bettyjack.com/funtone/nelson/johnwithdick/)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Nelson Sullivan Video Collection is a collection of videorecordings made by video artist Nelson Sullivan (1948-1989). The collection consists of videotapes, film, photographic material and objects related to the city's art world and LGBT community as well as performances in clubs, house parties, and interactions with Sullivan's friends. The videos cover the period 1976-1989.
The collection is comprised of four series:
Series I: Videorecordings contains 8 boxes of videorecordings made by Nelson Sullivan.
Series II: Film (currently unavailable)
Series III: Photographic Material contains 1 binder of slides covering the period between 1975 and 1977.
Series IV: Objects (currently unavailable)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Nelson Sullivan Video Collection; MSS 357; unique identification number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Nelson Sullivan Video Collection was donated to Fales Library by the estate of Nelson Sullivan, overseen by Dick Richards, David Goldman, and Robert Coddington operating collectively as the 5 Ninth Avenue Project, in September 2012.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Access to some audiovisual materials in this collection is available through digitized access copies. Researchers may view an item's original container, but the media themselves are not available for playback because of preservation concerns. Materials that have already been digitized are noted in the collection's finding aid and can be requested in our reading room. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact special.collections@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Content notes are available in an external document. Created by New York University's Media Preservation Unit, the notes describe the content of the recordings as observed by a technician during digitization. These notes include: description of the action, recognizable names and locations, and screen captures. For access to this document, please contact the audiovisual archivist at Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu.

arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

did.unittitle: Ameri/cain Gothic by Paul Carter Harrison

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This video shows an undated performance of Paul Carter Harrison's play Ameri/cain Gothic, starring Sylvia Miles and Moses Gunn and directed by Woodie King, Jr.

did.unittitle: Now Explosion at the Pyramid Club

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Part one of this video from November 16, 1983, shows Nelson spending time in the Pyramid Club dressing room prior to a performance by the Atlanta, Georgia, band The Now Explosion. Among those in the video are Deloris French, John Sex, and members of The Now Explosion.

Part two of this video is a continuation of The Now Explosion performing at the Pyramid Club. After their performance, there is a dance contest with Doctor Tony and Joan Ransom from the PTA, then footage from the Pyramid Club dressing room after the show. Finally, there is footage of a party Nelson attends in "Bobby and John's" apartment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Original Tape 1 (of 2)

The first disc of this video starts with footage from the morning of November 20, 1983, when the Chelsea Hotel lobby is being prepared for a party. Nelson goes to room 604 to spend time with friends, including Sandy Dancer, Michael Musto, and Deloris French. Sandy Dancer prepares for her performance later in the day. When a news camera crew interviews Sandy, she says that the party is a birthday celebration for the Chelsea.

The second disc begins with people flowing in and out of room 604 while Sandy Dancer finishes preparing for her performance. There is a dance performance in the stairwell before the main party in the lobby, where, among others, Sandy Dancer and Michael Musto perform. Ed Koch appears after a couple songs in order to honor the Chelsea Hotel on its 100th anniversary and declare November 20, 1983 Chelsea Hotel Day. Koch also presents playwright Arthur Miller with a plaque honoring his time living at the Chelsea. Miller gives brief remarks before the unveiling of his plaque. Ulick O'Connor speaks on behalf of the history of the Chelsea, and there are a couple more performances.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Original Tape 2 (of 2)

This video documents performances and a party in the Chelsea Hotel lobby on November 20, 1983. Towards the end of the night, someone in the hotel accidentally pulls a fire alarm and everyone moves outside temporarily. Among those featured are Sandy Dancer, Sylvia Miles, and Cookie Mueller.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Current DVD is damaged and skips from around 56 minutes to 58 minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On June 13, 1986, Nelson films a performance by Joshua at Darinka. The Because Family Picnic (John, Dina, and Joshua) performs in between two sets by Joshua. For a short amount of time, Nelson goes backstage and speaks with the performers. The video ends with Nelson walking alone down the street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The video starts with Nelson and friends driving to Pizza-a-Go-Go for White Trash Night on October 10, 1984. When they arrive, Nelson wanders around the building before Michael Musto and the Must's performance starts. He bumps into Musto in the dressing room getting ready and warming up. Then, Michael Musto and the Must perform covers of popular songs by girl groups. After the show, Nelson goes backstage with the musicians and others for a while before going to the kitchen, where a Beatles cover band is performing. Then, Nelson and friends drive around and end up in a cafe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Video of the first part of the December 3, 1983 performance of Hollywood Hell, a comedy by Michael Musto starring Crystal Field and directed by John Albano at Theater for a New City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Video of the second part of the December 3, 1983 performance of Hollywood Hell, a comedy by Michael Musto starring Crystal Field and directed by John Albano at Theater for a New City.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access DVD available by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson and his friends get dinner near the Chelsea Hotel before heading to Limelight for a show on April 1, 1986. When they arrive at Limelight, Nelson records the performers getting ready to perform in the dressing room. Then he moves to the dancefloor to record the audience before Tabboo!'s puppet show. After that ends, Shazork (Lady Bunny, DJ Dmitri Brill, and Sister Dimension's band) takes the stage. After the show, Nelson heads back stage briefly before leaving Limelight and heading to the a restaurant, where the video ends.

did.unittitle: Atlanta: RuPaul at Weekends and Larry Tee's Celebrity Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The video starts with RuPaul gogo dancing at the Atlanta nightclub Weekends on February 27, 1986, then Nelson goes into RuPaul's private dressing room with Larry Tee and a couple of others. When RuPaul finishes his set, he joins the group. The video jumps to the next day, with Nelson spending time in a friend's house. His friend then gives him a tour on a drive through Atlanta on their way to lunch at Burton's Grill. The tour continues before they return to the house where Larry Tee and others have gathered to watch some recorded performances. Larry Tee then takes Nelson on a drive to what will become Larry Tee's Celebrity Club for a tour, which is still under construction. The video jumps again, to Nelson chatting with drag queens (Sultra, Wanda, and others) getting ready for the night and then doing a private performance/interview for Nelson. Finally, the video jumps to recordings of music videos by Spencer Thorton for The Now Explosion, RuPaul, and an unknown band. The video cuts off at the beginning of a clip titled "RuPaul, Tune-Up King."

did.unittitle: Atlanta (2): David Goldman's Party and Butthole Surfers at 688

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: In disc one, Nelson is in Atlanta at a house party at David Goldman's with Lahoma, Lurleen, and James at the beginning of this video dated February 28, 1986. The video then jumps to a Butthole Surfers concert at 688 later that night.
Disc two is a continuation of the Butthole Surfers footage. Nelson leaves 688 with friends, and the last eleven minutes contain no footage.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On October 12, 1984, Nelson attended RuPaul's performance in Danceteria. The video starts with a group getting ready in RuPaul's dressing room, then shows all of the performance, featuring special guest Miss Felicia. After the show, Nelson goes backstage to congratulate RuPaul and Felicia on the show, and he spends the rest of the recording the group hanging out there.

did.unittitle: Louise Nevelson in Conversation at the Guggenheim

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson and Sylvia Miles attend a dialogue between sculptor Louise Nevelson and critic and editor of New Criterion Hilton Kramer at the Guggenheim in this video, dated March 5, 1986. The conversation is in celebration of Nevelson's being awarded The Great Artist Series Award by New York University's Gallatin Division, for her contribution to international art and culture. After the talk, Nelson and Sylvia go to the reception in the Guggenheim's rotunda, where they speak with Louise.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson records performers getting ready for the March 15, 1986 show of Ethyl Eichelberger's campy comedy Casanova at the Performing Garage, starring Eichelberger, Lady Bunny, Lola Pashalinski, Katy Dierlam, and Barbara Wise. Nelson briefly goes backstage after the performance, where among the crowds, Sylvia Miles and Peter Hujar are present.

did.unittitle: Hapi Phace at Pompeii Gallery and Bye Bye Birdie at The Saint

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This March 27, 1986 video shows Hapi Phace giving Nelson a tour of his show at Pompeii Gallery. Nelson then attends the midnight performance of Scott Wittman's production of Bye Bye Birdie, presented by Gabriel Rottello at The Saint.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Disc one of this video starts with Nelson receiving a phone call from Liz to make plans on March 15, 1986. Then Nelson spends time with his dog, Blackout, and his cats, Freddie and Eddie, telling them that it's his birthday. He takes Blackout for a short walk before heading to 7A Cafe to meet his friends, including Michael Musto. Nelson, Michael, and Liz then travel to Musto's family home.

In disc two, Nelson, Michael, and Liz finally arrive at the Musto's family home in Bensonhurst and chat with Michael's family. They then drive to Albert's new house, receive a tour, and eat dinner. Nelson, Michael, and Liz leave Albert's apartment, and the video ends with them in the car.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

did.unittitle: Shazork at Zulu Lounde and Lady Bunny and Dimetri at Southern Funk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This video documents the March 23, 1986 at The Zulu Lounge, including a performance by Shazork (Lady Bunny, DJ Dmitri Brill, and Sister Dimension's band). After the show, Nelson spends a little time backstage with the band. It also shows the May 1, 1986, Lady Bunny and Dimetri performance at Southern Funk Cafe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On October 9, 1985, Nelson films Brant and Rhonda's wedding ceremony and party.

did.unittitle: Michael Musto and the Must in Boston

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This undated video starts with Nelson spending time with friends. The group then loads up a van and drives to Boston for a concert by Michael Musto and the Must. The video shows the band warming up and then spending time in their hotel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On January 29, 1986, Nelson creates a video for Pat Field in the Patricia Field Store, which is having a sale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson and friends attend a birthday party for Bobby Reed in an apartment in this undated video.

did.unittitle: The Now Explosion at the Pyramid Club

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Disc one shows The Now Explosion performing at The Pyramid Club. Towards the end of their performance, they're joined on stage by RuPaul. After the show, Nelson goes backstage to spend time with the band.

Disc two is a continuation of The Now Explosion's performance at The Pyramid Club on the same night. After a short break, they take the stage again, and RuPaul once again joins them for a few songs. Lady Bunny also joins them onstage for a couple songs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson is backstage with Buster Poindexter and the other musicians while they warm up before their show at Limelight on November 19, 1985, then heads out to the audience. The show is celebrating Buster Poindexter's birthday. Susan Kirschner joins Buster on stage for several songs. Afterwards, Nelson goes backstage again briefly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On August 29 and 30, 1984, Nelson records his stay in Provincetown. Nelson and Sylvia Miles explore Provincetown together, bumping into friends wherever they go.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On August 27 and 28, 1984, Nelson records his stay in Provincetown. The video features Nelson, Sylvia Miles, Bob Haas, and others exploring the town at a leisurely pace.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On disc one, Nelson and Sylvia Miles attend Michael Musto's birthday party at Amsterdam's restaurant with many others on December 18, 1985. The video ends with a group going outside to hail a cab.
On disc two, more people arrive at the party, including a singing stripper, Jon St. John, and Andy Warhol. Nelson and friends leave the party and take a cab.

did.unittitle: Beyond the Valley of La Cage at Limelight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This video documents the December 17, 1985 drag show at Limelight, Beyond the Valley of La Cage. Nelson goes backstage and shows some of the performers getting ready for the night. Then he films the performance, which features drag queens impersonating their favorite pop stars. After the show, Nelson goes backstage to spend time with the performers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson is backstage at the Pyramid Club with Shazork as they get ready to perform on May 12, 1986. He then films their short teaser performance, before filming their later full performance.

did.unittitle: David Chicklet's Birthday Party, Shazork at Danceteria, and Shazork at the Pyramid Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This video opens with David Chicklet's tenth birthday party at Limelight on December 6, 1985, where Michael Musto and others make an appearance. After that, Nelson heads to Danceteria for Shazork's performance. The video also shows footage from December 15 at the Pyramid Club, for a show by an unidentified band, then Shazork at The Whispers Party at the Pyramid Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nelson attends Joy Askew's performance at the Cat Club on January 14, 1986. He heads backstage briefly before Askew's set, then records the entire show. Before the video ends, he parties backstage for a bit.

did.unittitle: New Year's Eve at Pyramid with Love Delegation and Shazork #2

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: DVD access copy available. Please request Part 1 and Part 2.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: On disc one, Nelson is backstage at the Pyramid Club with friends as they wait for the performances on New Year's Eve. Nelson then heads to the dancefloor for a set by Peter Zaremba's Love Delegation with Wendy Wild and Liz Luv from Das Frlines.

On disc two, Peter Zaremba's Love Delegation's performance continues. After the set, Nelson once again goes backstage. Throughout the video, a drag queen naps on a couch while everyone parties around her, but Nelson keeps returning to her. Shazork takes the stage and performs. The video ends with Nelson and the band backstage.

This DVD is divided into 3 parts:
Part 1 features Michael Musto and Larry T listening to musics and rapping on a street corner of New York.
Part 2 is a continuation of Nelson following his friends. He records his car ride with Larry T.

Part 3 allows us to get a tour of Nelson's bedroom, filled with a shoe and tie collection, oil painting supplies, and an editing center. Nelson and his friends then take a trip through a New York City park and bump into some acquaintances, Carey, Rose, and their baby Emily, while walking around.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Majority of this video contains male performers stripping in an unidentified nightclub. At 5:20 am, Nelson and two men are walking down the street with their crates of Vinyl. After stopping at "Lox around the Clock", Nelson gets into his cab and records the streets of New York.

While settled near Woodstock in Bearsville, NY, Nelson and his friends, Brant and Rhonda, are staying at the estate of Archipenko. After a brief tour the environment around their cottage, the video cuts to the following day where the group sets out to meet Frances Archipenko, the curator of the estate and the wife of the late artist, and Marshall and Eve Baer at the Rainbow Lodge. The footage ends with Nelson's visit to Marshall's studio before going to catch his bus back home.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: [1] -- House Party & Twilight Zone, 6/19/1987 [2] -- Thanksgiving (part 2), 11/25/1987

Dated for June 19th, 1987, Nelson starts his night in an apartment with a group of friends, including Michael Musto, who are listening to music and playing the guessing game "What am I?". The video transitions to the group visiting the party downstairs. After going back upstairs to the main apartment, Nelson makes a plan to go home as his friends go to Cafe Sandino, while Michael Musto, James St. James, and Michael Angelo make their way to "The Tunnel" for the night. While back in his own apartment, Nelson talks to the camera face to face about his plan to visit Coney Island the following day. The the view cuts to a dinner with his friends.

Sponsored by the Fashion Patrol, this video starts with a competition for "Best Wig". Judges are Ms. Robby, James St. James, Michael Musto, Ms. Brandywine Heaven, and Michael Angelo. The next day, Nelson has plans to go watch the filming of "Slaves of New York" in the East Village where we run into Michael Musto again. The video then switches to a party in a New York apartment, where we find the "String Fellows" interviewing people about a fashion show that was attended. It then ends with plans to go to Palladium.

daodesc.p: Road trip 88 to Atlanta #1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Starting at a rest stop, Nelson Sullivan and a group of his friends set off to meet up with a friend in Georgia. They speak about the reality of living in New York and the changing plans concerning their stay in Atlanta, getting ready to shoot a video with Michael Musto. The video ends with a sound check at a venue in Atlanta.

dao.xlink:title: Nelson Talking

daodesc.p: Nelson Talking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: At 11:30 pm on March 5th, the night starts with plans to visit Mars Bar for bingo night. Without hesitation to catch the light green sign that spells out "DRUGS", Nelson Sullivan filmed this particular footage for an HBO special at the "Mars Needs Bingo" event that happens once a month. Features Lahoma Van Zant, also referred to as "Bingo Carla", who is offered a part in a short film for the New York Lesbian & Gay Film and Video Festival. Later in the evening, the viewer is provided backstage access before a RuPaul dance and vocal performance during "Gay Night" at Mars Bar. The announcement of the passing of Steven Comb, who died from AIDs, was announced. Lastly, we are given the opportunity to experience backstage access after the show with a small cameo of Michael Musto.

did.unittitle: Marrs & then Nelson goes to PYRAMID to see Bunny

dao.xlink:title: Marrs & then Nelson goes to PYRAMID to see Bunny

daodesc.p: Marrs & then Nelson goes to PYRAMID to see Bunny

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Part one of this video entry provides its audience a chance to construct a vision of nightlife in New York. Nelson and his friends are on their way to The Pyramid Club to catch Lady Bunny's voice performance sets. This specific entry possesses footage of the entire first set and part of the second. Also features a drag performance of First Ladies Nancy Reagan and Barbara Bush doing a musical duet of "Bosom Buddies".

Part two of this video is a continuation of Lady Bunny's second performance at The Pyramid Club, along with a "Sister Dimensions" performance of an original poem. At the end of the show, after recording the ambiance of the backstage area and entire area of the venue, Sullivan ends his night by recording the streets of New York during his cab ride home, looking out of the windshield and focused on the surrounding neighborhood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage shot outside of Nelson's apartment at 5 9th Avenue, with four visitors, three human and one canine. One woman appears first, carrying a pile of documents and a basketball. Another woman and a man appear, along with a dog. Blackout (Nelson's dog) is also present; the two dogs interact.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of animals in a zoo, including a lion, a baboon, alligators, crocodiles, an otter, goats, deer, and more.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage shot on the streets of New York's Upper East Side; pedestrians, businesses, and vehicles. The camera is often shaky and out of focus.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage shot in Nelson's apartment: a self-portrait in a mirror in the nude, views out the windows, polished fingernails, a cat (Douglas), and the kitchen. The second half of the film depicts Nelson cooking Brown 'n' Serve sausages in a frying pan.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten titles reading "Sunshine in New York: 1972 | John Nelson Sullivan". The title is shot over and over again, with various zooms, pans, and focus pulls. At one point the camera pulls back to reveal the space in which the title was being filmed.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage shot inside of an apartment. A woman plays piano and a man watches television. He drinks from a mug.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage shot from the roof of Nelson's building, shows pedestrians, vehicles, neighboring buildings, cyclists, and more. Features aggressive camera movements and zooms.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film begins with footage shot in darkness, showing a lit light bulb, a raging fire, and the lights of emergency vehicles. Second half is daylight footage shot in Nelson's apartment, showing interiors, and shots from the window of pedestrians, men urinating on a wall, foliage, and neighboring buildings. There is a brief shot of Blackout lounging on the floor.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of people at the Bethesda Fountain and Terrace in Central Park, many in costumes. See cuid6940.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.; No image, not digitized.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of neon "Food Stop" sign and other signs, shot from a building across the street.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage shot on Nelson's rooftop, featuring neighboring buildings and chimneys, as well as Nelson's boots and film cartridges.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film of Washington Square, featuring in-camera editing effects and zooms. Shots show the arch, pedestrians, dogs, and more, and is shot in at least two different frame rates so that portions of the film appear to be in slow motion.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Homemade "The End" title cards.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film begins with footage shot in South Carolina in or about 1972. Features shots from and of a Porsche 911E, including gas stations on and around East Church Street, of Dodd's store, and of a man in white entering a house. This exterior footage is followed by a title, shot against a TV screen, which reads "FIVE THINGS TO LOOK AT | NELSON SULLIVAN | 1972".

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of people in Central Park at the Bethesda Fountain and Terrace, boating on the Lake, and walking on Bow Bridge and on paths.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 4 min.; Black leader, not digitized.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of a cat (Douglas), titles reading "FIVE MOVEMENTS" and "the end," and Nelson in the nude in a mirror.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Original format: Super 8mm film, Duration: 3 min.

scopecontent.p: Footage of a swinging lampshade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Commercial copy of a pornographic film.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gay pornography / stag film interspliced with title cards and credits of feature films; Title cards include: "Pope Visits - Soft Ver" and many others; A collage of various film segments, title cards, head leaders, tens of very short segments, including films such as Lawrence of Arabia, but alos gay pornography scenes and intertitles.

scopecontent.p: Commercial copy of Target Studios's film "Bayside."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original film containers that held 8mm and Super8mm films shot by Nelson Sullivan (see cuids 6924-6982). Handwritten annotations are found on many of the containers.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The films have been digitized, rehoused, and stored separately for conservation reasons. See cuid6924-cuid6982 for details about the content.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Slides include:

Building of Pyramids on the Beach of F.I.: Kodachrome 64; Eddie and Freddy, Fire Island, Pyramid Scenes: Kodachrome 64, 20 exps.; Fire Island, Eddie and Freddy: Kodachrome 64; Fire Island, Nelson Haircutting Seen: Kodachrome 25; From Roof at 5 9th Ave; Good Ice Palace, Inside and Out; July 4th 1976 Cherry Grove; Masako and Her Baby, Chelsea Street, Fire Island and Nelson: some good double exposure, Kodachrome 64; Untitled
